unit.name: 2 Panzer Division HQ
unit.History: The division was raised in 1935, and moved into Austria in 1938, where it earned the nickname "Vienna Division". It saw action in Poland in 1939, in the west in 1940 and in the Balkans in 1941. It took part in the invasion of the Soviet Union, fighting in the central sector. In 1944 it was sent to France for rest and refitting. It fought in Normandy and suffered very heavy casualties breaking out of the Falaise Gap. Rebuilt, it was part of the 5th Panzer Army in the Ardennes. During the offensive. It penetrated deeper into the Allied lines than any other German division.

commander.Name: Meinrad von Lauchert
commander.PersBio:
Meinrad von Lauchert began his military career as a Officer Cadet on 1 April 1924. As a Captain, he commanded the 2nd Company of Panzer Regiment 35, but on the first day of the campaign in Poland he was promoted to battalion commander after the previous commander was injured.
Lauchert served with Panzer Regiment 35 of the 4th Panzer Division throughout the canpaigns in Poland and France. During the invasion of Russia in the summer of 1941, he earned the Knight's Cross to the Iron Cross.
In 1943, Guderian assigned Major Lauchert to form and train the first two battalions of the new Mk V Panther tanks. The Kursk offensive was actually delayed until Lauchert's Panthers arrived to spearhead the southern arm of the attack.
Lauchert continued to command a battle group of Panthers after Kursk. He was promoted to Lieutenant Colonel and eventually commanded Panzer Regiment 15 of the 11th Panzer Division, earning the Oak Leaves to his Knight's Cross.
In the summer of 1944, Lauchert was given the command of Panzer Brigade 101. Two days before the start of the Ardennes Offensive, Colonel Lauchert was assigned to command the 2nd Panzer Division, replacing a commander who Lüttwitz felt was an inexperienced panzer leader.

commander.Name: Ernst von Cochenhausen
commander.PersBio: Cochenhausen, a former battalion commander, probably only took command of Panzer-Grenadier Regiment 304 a few days after the start of the offensive. His predecessor (after Christian Kübler) remains unknown.

unit.name: 3 Coy 38 Pz Pion Bn
unit.History: Elements of the 2nd Panzer Division Pioneer Bn that infiltrated across the Our in the early morning hours of December 16. They had no bridging equipment and were intended to be used as assault companies thus they have no Engineering capabilities.
